info.description:
# flowable / flow…ôb(…ô)l /

- a compact and highly efficient workflow and Business Process Management (BPM) platform for developers, system admins and business users.
- a lightning fast, tried and tested BPMN 2 process engine written in Java. It is Apache 2.0 licensed open source, with a committed community.
- can run embedded in a Java application, or as a service on a server, a cluster, and in the cloud. It integrates perfectly with Spring. With a rich Java and REST API, it is the ideal engine for orchestrating human or system activities.
info.title: Flowable CONTENT REST API

200.description: Indicates the engine info is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given id.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given name.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a name like the given value.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given mime type.

parameters.name: mimeTypeLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a mime type like the given value.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given task id.

parameters.name: taskIdLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a task like the given value.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given process instance id.

parameters.name: processInstanceIdLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a process instance like the given value.

parameters.name: contentStoreId
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given content store id.

parameters.name: contentStoreIdLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a content store id like the given value.

parameters.name: contentStoreName
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given content store name.

parameters.name: contentStoreNameLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a content store name like the given value.

parameters.name: contentAvailable
parameters.description: Only return content items with or without content available.

parameters.name: contentSize
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given content size.

parameters.name: minimumContentSize
parameters.description: Only return content items with the a minimum content size of the given value.

parameters.name: maximumContentSize
parameters.description: Only return content items with the a maximum content size of the given value.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given field.

parameters.name: fieldLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a field like the given value.

parameters.name: createdOn
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given create date.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return content items before given create date.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return content items after given create date.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given created by.

parameters.name: createdByLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a created by like the given value.

parameters.name: lastModifiedOn
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given last modified date.

parameters.name: lastModifiedBefore
parameters.description: Only return content items before given last modified date.

parameters.name: lastModifiedAfter
parameters.description: Only return content items after given last modified date.

parameters.name: lastModifiedBy
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given last modified by.

parameters.name: lastModifiedByLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a last modified by like the given value.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return content items with the given tenantId.

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return content items with a tenantId like the given value.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: If true, only returns content items without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

post.summary: Create a new content item, with content item information and an optional attached file
post.description:
## Create a new content item, with content item information

 ```JSON
{
  "name":"Simple content item",
  "mimeType":"application/pdf",
  "taskId":"12345",
  "processInstanceId":"1234"
  "contentStoreId":"5678",
  "contentStoreName":"myFileStore"
  "field":"uploadField",
  "createdBy":"johndoe"
  "lastModifiedBy":"johndoe",
  "tenantId":"myTenantId"
} ```


Only the content item name is required to create a new content item.



## Create a new content item with an attached file

The request should be of type multipart/form-data. There should be a single file-part included with the binary value of the variable. On top of that, the following additional form-fields can be present:

- *name*: Required name of the content item.

- *mimeType*: Mime type of the content item, optional.

- *taskId*: Task identifier for the content item, optional.

- *processInstanceId*: Process instance identifier for the content item, optional.

- *contentStoreId*: The identifier of the content item in an external content store, optional.

- *contentStoreName*: The name of an external content store, optional.

- *field*: The form field for the content item, optional.

- *createdBy*: The user identifier that created the content item, optional.

- *lastModifiedBy*: The user identifier that last modified the content item, optional.

- *tenantId*: The tenant identifier of the content item, optional.

201.description: Indicates the content item was created and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates required content item info is missing from the request.

200.description: Indicates the content item was found and returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested content item was not found.

put.summary: Updates a content item, with the provided content item information
put.description:
## Updates a content item, with the provided content item information

 ```JSON
{
  "name":"Simple content item",
  "mimeType":"application/pdf",
  "taskId":"12345",
  "processInstanceId":"1234"
  "contentStoreId":"5678",
  "contentStoreName":"myFileStore"
  "field":"uploadField",
  "createdBy":"johndoe"
  "lastModifiedBy":"johndoe",
  "tenantId":"myTenantId"
} ```

- *name*: Name of the content item.

- *mimeType*: Mime type of the content item, optional.

- *taskId*: Task identifier for the content item, optional.

- *processInstanceId*: Process instance identifier for the content item, optional.

- *contentStoreId*: The identifier of the content item in an external content store, optional.

- *contentStoreName*: The name of an external content store, optional.

- *field*: The form field for the content item, optional.

- *createdBy*: The user identifier that created the content item, optional.

- *lastModifiedBy*: The user identifier that last modified the content item, optional.

- *tenantId*: The tenant identifier of the content item, optional.

200.description: Indicates the content item was updated and the result is returned.

404.description: Indicates content item could not be found.

204.description: Indicates the content item was deleted.

404.description: Indicates the content item was not found.

get.summary: Get the data of a content item
get.description: The response body contains the binary content. By default, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream unless the content item type contains a valid mime type.

200.description: Indicates the content item was found and the requested content is returned.

404.description: Indicates the content item was not found or the content item doesn°Øt have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

post.description:
## Save the content item data with an attached file

The request should be of type multipart/form-data. There should be a single file-part included with the binary value of the content item.

201.description: Indicates the content item data was saved and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates required content item data is missing from the request.

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of content items, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri°Øs that are too long.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the content items are returned.

400.description: Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.
